summary: Okay so yeah Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon aren’t exactly the best follow-ups (I actually really love them) but they do one thing...
body:
Okay so yeah Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon aren’t exactly the best follow-ups (I actually really love them) but they do one thing that’s both absolutely incredible from a thematic standpoint and also really easy to miss: The Kantonian Gym on Ula’Ula Island.

Hawai’i in the real world has to deal with a bunch of tourists trying to claim that they’re receiving the real Hawai’i experience by doing shit that they really have no knowledge of. A luau isn’t just some big dinner, it’s a celebration of multiple occasions like a graduation, a wedding, and a birthday all at the same time complete with entertainment. It’s something so deeply ingrained in the culture that when people don’t get it, it’s really easy to tell that they don’t. That’s just one example.

Meanwhile in Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon, there’s the Kantonian Gym on Ula’Ula Island in Malie City. Once you enter, you’re immediately treated as a customer and have to pay a fee to get in. It’s a recreation of Lt. Surge’s gym from the Kanto Region but there’s a lot that you can immediately tell is wrong if you’ve never played a game that let you battle Lt. Surge in his gym; there’s no electric gate that you need to deactivate with the switch in the trash cans, all of the trainers in there are Beauty-type, not a single trainer or even the “Gym Leader” has an electric type, and you see other people not battling each other, but just talking with their drinks in their hands. And your reward for beating the gym is a badge with no value whatsoever and a bunch of Pokebeans and drinks.

It like so perfectly encapsulates what most tourists think of certain traditions in Hawai’i that it’s kinda genius. They don’t understand the intricacies of what’s going on and that imitating the motions and the concepts makes it all the exact same thing. 

Would it be appropriate to call it good cultural appropriation? Probably not.

summary:
Den's weird dream theater time:
So the dream starts off weird. First off this is the pokemon world but it's also blended a bit...
body:
Den’s weird dream theater time:

So the dream starts off weird. First off this is the pokemon world but it’s also blended a bit with reality. My family has an Umbreon, Espeon, and some baby black fox kind of pokemon that we call Kitty (she’s actually my old pomeranian I used to have). We live in this wooded, mountainous community where they warn us of some impending prophecy. Standard mystic babble, who cares

Except the sky opens up in the distance and a torrent of lava and weird, tribal/spartan soldiers appear. We all try to make our escape and obviously we don’t all make it, including a few family members. Dad and my Aunt grab our nieces and one of the enemy guys torches our Umbreon alive. At this point we’re just trying to escape now, and we drive away in horror as everything we know goes ablaze.

Cue somebody from the enemy side gone rogue. They tell us that these people are from the future and harbingers of an apocalypse that has torn their world. Supposedly it was the actions of one person that brought this, and apparently most of humanity has let blind rage substitute their reasoning and want to punish the past for ruining the future. Apparently they’re also a bunch of dumbasses too, but I digress. Rogue ends up joining our party with a pokemon I understand to be some alternate form of Salazzle with magma wings, claws, and sharp teeth.

He warns us that the attacks on the past happen very much like the one on our town at precise times. This introduces a time limit we have to be in certain towns. It’s pretty bad because my dad wants to leave at 11:15 even though the rogue guy says we should leave at 11:05. Lo and behold we’re on the road again just barely avoiding another town destruction, my poor aunt having to ride in a side car for some reason.

We stop by another town and we can’t get past this mountain area without something to move giant boulders, AKA strength. Dad has never been one for battles and my aunt hates pokemon except for poor Espeon, still mourning Umbreon. My older niece, 4, somehow has neglected to inform us that she smuggled her mom’s Sylveon out, so we feed our mons and get searching through the town, because we have 2 hours to find and beat a gym leader for the badge and find the necessary HM.

We find a gym leader, and he’s this guy I hate from school. He actually refuses to fight me because he’s still pissy about a soda from 5 years ago. I’m already pissed and just have Kitty use Ice Fang because I hate him and we’re on a time limit. Cue full blown fight with his team and my Kitty, Espeon, Sylveon, and Rogue’s Salazzle, plus a random water type Arcanine I had made IRL that somehow slipped in. He had a Mega Gyarados, Scizor, Charizard, an Alolan Golem, and some new pokemon that’s like a diamond skin mountain lion that I inherently understood was fast and powerful as a fairy and steel type.

Once I beat him with my pokemon I start beating him with my fist just because he’s that much of an ass. I tell him to give me the badge and HM, and he tells me that they no longer have HM’s. He throws the badge at my face and leaves. My dad tries to give me a stern talking to and my niece keeps hugging my pokemon but Rogue is at a loss for words. We can’t escape now without the HM.

My dad loads his revolver and says “then let’s stop runnin’.” Granted this man is 60, has rods in his back and legs, feeble as hell, and uses a cane even in the dream, and he wants to fight the apocalypse Spartans. My aunt is entirely against it but you know? I’ve had it with these guys too, and we convince the rogue to help us. We give my aunt the keys and tell her to get the kids out another way, and we proceed to find a hill.

I carry my dad on my back and Rogue has his Salazzle at the ready. As soon as the portal in the sky opens, we all fly through it screaming while Kitty, on my shoulder, shoots out Ice Beams at falling Soldiers and my dad just shoots at them and takes a few out.

The dream ends on a cliff hanger in this metropolis atop an ocean of oil and under a completely blacked out sky, the city barely lit by the smoldering ashes and cinders around it. I’m asthmatic and any smoke seriously messes with me, so I wake up coughing.

I just love how myself and my niece keep pokemon hidden, how dumb these Spartans are, how done with these guys my dad is towards the end, and also unironically this system and theming. No I don’t necessarily want death and destruction in a future game but I mean? The time limit, realistic world and darker theming was neato. I also want to sprite out these mystery mons.

Rogue ends up joining our party with a pokemon I understand to be some alternate form of Salazzle with magma wings, claws, and sharp teeth.

He warns us that the attacks on the past happen very much like the one on our town at precise times. This introduces a time limit we have to be in certain towns. It’s pretty bad because my dad wants to leave at 11:15 even though the rogue guy says we should leave at 11:05. Lo and behold we’re on the road again just barely avoiding another town destruction, my poor aunt having to ride in a side car for some reason.

We stop by another town and we can’t get past this mountain area without something to move giant boulders, AKA strength. Dad has never been one for battles and my aunt hates pokemon except for poor Espeon, still mourning Umbreon. My older niece, 4, somehow has neglected to inform us that she smuggled her mom’s Sylveon out, so we feed our mons and get searching through the town, because we have 2 hours to find and beat a gym leader for the badge and find the necessary HM.

We find a gym leader, and he’s this guy I hate from school. He actually refuses to fight me because he’s still pissy about a soda from 5 years ago. I’m already pissed and just have Kitty use Ice Fang because I hate him and we’re on a time limit. Cue full blown fight with his team and my Kitty, Espeon, Sylveon, and Rogue’s Salazzle, plus a random water type Arcanine I had made IRL that somehow slipped in. He had a Mega Gyarados, Scizor, Charizard, an Alolan Golem, and some new pokemon that’s like a diamond skin mountain lion that I inherently understood was fast and powerful as a fairy and steel type.

Once I beat him with my pokemon I start beating him with my fist just because he’s that much of an ass. I tell him to give me the badge and HM, and he tells me that they no longer have HM’s. He throws the badge at my face and leaves. My dad tries to give me a stern talking to and my niece keeps hugging my pokemon but Rogue is at a loss for words. We can’t escape now without the HM.

My dad loads his revolver and says “then let’s stop runnin’.” Granted this man is 60, has rods in his back and legs, feeble as hell, and uses a cane even in the dream, and he wants to fight the apocalypse Spartans. My aunt is entirely against it but you know? I’ve had it with these guys too, and we convince the rogue to help us. We give my aunt the keys and tell her to get the kids out another way, and we proceed to find a hill.

I carry my dad on my back and Rogue has his Salazzle at the ready. As soon as the portal in the sky opens, we all fly through it screaming while Kitty, on my shoulder, shoots out Ice Beams at falling Soldiers and my dad just shoots at them and takes a few out.

The dream ends on a cliff hanger in this metropolis atop an ocean of oil and under a completely blacked out sky, the city barely lit by the smoldering ashes and cinders around it. I’m asthmatic and any smoke seriously messes with me, so I wake up coughing.

I just love how myself and my niece keep pokemon hidden, how dumb these Spartans are, how done with these guys my dad is towards the end, and also unironically this system and theming. No I don’t necessarily want death and destruction in a future game but I mean? The time limit, realistic world and darker theming was neato. I also want to sprite out these mystery mons.

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Starchen Starly and Archen fusion Rock/Flying type Ability: Cute Charm/Fluffy Stat: HP - 60, Atk - 85, Def - 50, SpA - 40, SpD -...
caption:
Starchen

Starly and Archen fusion

Rock/Flying type

Ability: Cute Charm/Fluffy

Stat: HP - 60, Atk - 85, Def - 50, SpA - 40, SpD - 50, Spe - 75

The Big Beak Pokemon

This pokefusion loves feasting on bug type pokemon and can store many in its big beak. It has been found that it hasn’t evolved much since ancient times as it is such a successful predator.  Many keep it as a pet as its feathers are really soft and it’s very good with children.

Request for anon. I hope you like it! I don’t think I’ve fused a starly or an archen before.

summary: Tropius - 357
title: Tropius - 357
body:
It flies by flapping its broad leaves. The bunch of fruit that grows around its neck is deliciously sweet. In the spring, it scatters pollen from its neck.

- Pokemon Emerald

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

summary: [ Post-MechaCon 2318 ~ Sketch Commission 2 ] My second & last take-home sketch commission from MechaCon! It never fails to warm...
caption:
[ Post-MechaCon 2318 ~ Sketch Commission 2 ]

My second & last take-home sketch commission from MechaCon! It never fails to warm my heart when I’m told that a commission is planned to be a gift. So when the commissioner told me that this was to be a birthday gift for his boyfriend, I was absolutely giddy! It’s a very flattering thought to know I was entrusted with the task of creating a very personal gift. I only hope that they enjoyed it~ 

★ Commission Me | Twitter | Instagram | Ko-fi | Facebook | ETSY ★
